alert.note: Alert for St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 17 at 8:16PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN ST. LUCIE COUNTY... At 815 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Lakewood Park, or near Indrio, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Lakewood Park around 820 PM EDT. Indrio, Saint Lucie Airport and Saint Lucie Village around 830 PM EDT. Fort Pierce, Fort Pierce Inlet and Queens Cove around 840 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Fort Pierce Ocean Park. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
